page.title: 13 Place Names Around Barham.
page.content: The names of the villages and hamlets in the survey area tell us something about what the land was like hundreds of years ago.Barham itself means Beora's settlement,and might indicate the prescence of bears in the area, since bears are shown on the village sign,and on the coat of arms of Reginald Fitzurse,Knight,who is linked with the murder of Thomas a Becket. Woolage Green refers to the heathland where wolves roam.Ropersole Farm refers to a pool frequented by rooks. Maydeken and Finnis Woods refer to the families which owned the area in the 14th century.Shelvin means dwellers on shelving ground,while Walderchain means a forest-dwellers' cavern.Within Barham,Brickfield Lane and Railway Hill tell us things about features of the village which are long gone.
